NARRATIVE-CM:
Portugal seized 36 German ships in Portuguese ports on February 24, 1916, and Germany declared war against Portugal on March 9, 1916. Portuguese troops commanded by Major Portugal da Silva seized control of the Kionga district, Mozambique from German troops on April 11, 1916. Portugal mobilized some 100,000 troops, and the *Portuguese Expeditionary Force *(PEF) consisting of 40,000 troops commanded by General Tamagnini de Abreu e Silva was sent to France in January 1917. German troops entered Portuguese East Africa (Mozambique) from German East Africa (Tanganyika) on November 25, 1917. German troops defeated Portuguese troops near the Ludjenda River, resulting in the deaths of some 900 Portuguese soldiers. Some 7,200 Portuguese soldiers were killed during the *First World War*. Portugal announced its neutrality in the *Second World War* on September 3, 1939. A German submarine sank a Portuguese ship near the coast of Portugal on October 12, 1941, and sank a Portuguese ship in the Atlantic Ocean in December 1941. Portugal severed diplomatic relations with Germany on May 6, 1945.

Clodfelter, 1992, 753-755; Langer, 1972, 995-996, 1186-1187.
